basics.name: Alan Andre Guijarro Pomboza
basics.label: Software Engineer - Full Stack Developer
basics.summary: I am a driven Full Stack developer, committed to ongoing learning and consistently striving to elevate my skills while delivering innovative and efficient solutions.

work.name: National Electoral Council
work.summary:
• Developed dynamic and responsive user interfaces using Angular 16, ensuring a smooth and engaging user experience.
• Front-end development with React for interactive and user-friendly interfaces.
• Created custom CSS styles and JavaScript scripts for Angular components.
• Generated detailed reports using XtraReports.
• Developed Web APIs with .NET 6.
• Created stored procedures in Oracle 19c.
• Managed version control using Azure Repos.
• Contributed to software development and maintenance using Azure DevOps for Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery.

work.name: Toothforce
work.summary:
• Web APIs development using .NET 6.
• User interfaces development with ASP.NET MVC framework.
• Queries creation using LINQ and Entity Framework Core.
• Management and version control using Git.
• Integration of third-party components and libraries to improve system functionality and usability.
• Unit tests development with xUnit.
• Migration of .NET Framework APIs to .NET Core.
highlights: Created queries using LINQ and Entity Framework Core

work.name: TMG Group
work.summary:
• Web APIs development using .NET 6.
• Implementation of user interfaces with Razor Pages and ASP.NET Core MVC framework in .NET 6.
• Optimization of stored procedures in MySQL.
• Version control using Git and Bitbucket.
• Unit tests development with xUnit.
• Code documentation.
highlights: Version control with Git and BitBuckets

projects.name: Countable Project
projects.description: Accounting project aimed at political organizations in Ecuador, for the traceability of all accounting, including income, expenses, bank reconciliation, accounting entries, among others. The project was developed in Angular for the frontend and .net for the backend, with an Oracle19c database.
